DLV
Class DLV_Manager

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--DLV.DLV_Manager
public class DLV_Manager
extends java.lang.Object

This is a wrapper class that allows to call DLV from a Java program. Three methods of invocation are supplied: synchronous, model synchronous and asynchronous mode. In the first, the thread that starts DLV is blocked until DLV finish computation and then it is possible to get the output. In the second and in the third, we don't wait until DLV has finished, checking dynamically whether there are further models. When a DLV_Manager object is created standard DLV incation parameters are automatically set, but this class allows to set all DLV invocation paramaters.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Francesco Ricca

Field Detail

READY

public static final byte READY
The status of a DLV_Manager istance when DLV is running.

RUNNING

public static final byte RUNNING
The status of a DLV_Manager istance when DLV process is running.

FINISHED

public static final byte FINISHED
The status of a DLV_Manager istance when DLV process finished a computation.

KILLED

public static final byte KILLED
The status of a DLV_Manager istance when DLV process was killed.

SYNCHRONOUS

public static final byte SYNCHRONOUS
This constant indicates a kind of synchronization method of a DLV_Manager. If set when you call a model handling function you will wait until DLV process ends.

MODEL_SYNCHRONOUS

public static final byte MODEL_SYNCHRONOUS
This constant indicates a kind of synchronization method of a DLV_Manager. If set when you call a model handling function you will wait until DLV process generate a new model. This is the default method.

ASYNCHRONOUS

public static final byte ASYNCHRONOUS
This constant indicates a kind of synchronization method of a DLV_Manager. If set when you call a model handling function you wont wait DLV process computation. For example if you call getModel() and a DLV hasn't computed a model yet the method returns null without wait.

                   throws DLV_InvocationException
Deprecated. uses run() instead.

This function starts DLV in synchronous mode.
Throws:
DLV_InvocationException - If any error is occurred during DLV invocation.

computeModelsAsynchronously

public void computeModelsAsynchronously()
                                 throws DLV_InvocationException
Deprecated. uses run(ASYNCHRONOUS) instead.

This function starts DLV in asynchronous mode. This function blocks the current thread until DLV end.
Throws:
DLV_InvocationException - If any error is occurred during DLV invocation.

stopComputation

public void stopComputation()
                     throws DLV_InvocationException
Deprecated. use kill() instead.

This function kills the current DLV process. If this DLV_Manager istance isn't in RUNNING status this function performs no operation.

resetDLV_Manager

public void resetDLV_Manager()
Deprecated. use reset() instead.

This function resets the current DLV_Manager istance. If you call this function, the current DLV process will be killed, the internal data structures of this object will be cleared.

getDLV_Version

public java.lang.String getDLV_Version()
                                throws DLV_InvocationException
This function asks the selected DLV implementation for version information.
Returns:
A string which contains version informations in DLV output format.
Throws:
DLV_InvocationException - If some error is occurred during DLV invocation.

callDLVAndRedirectOutputInAFile

public void callDLVAndRedirectOutputInAFile(java.lang.String file)
                                     throws DLV_InvocationException
Calls DLV and redirect the output in the file file. This function works like a command line invocation of DLV and this DLV_Manager isn't responsible of this output (You must manage the output manipulating directly the file file. If you call a Model manipulation function like hasMoreModels() or nextModel() after calling this method NoSuchModelException will be thrown. The thread which calls this method is blocked until the operation is completed.
Parameters:
file - A String object which contains the full pathanme of a file where this object will redirect DLV output.
Throws:
DLV_InvocationException - If some error is occurred during DLV invocation.

removeModel

public void removeModel(int i)
This function allows to discard the i-th Model. The cursor moves a position up (to the (i-1)-th model).
Throws:
NoSuchModelException - Is trown if there are no models for this program now.
NoModelsComputed - If a computeModel function is never executed.

hasMoreModels

public boolean hasMoreModels()
                      throws DLV_InvocationException
Tests If there are more models available. If DLV is started in synchronous mode, this function blocks the current thread until first Model (or no model) is found.
Returns:
true if and only if there is at least one model in the file buffer after the current position; false otherwise.
Throws:
DLV_InvocationException - If any error is occurred during DLV invocation.
NoModelsComputed - If a computeModel function is never executed.

nextModel

public Model nextModel()
                throws DLV_InvocationException
Returns The next model available. The cursor moves a position down. If DLV is started in synchronous mode, this function blocks the current thread until a new Model (or no model) is found.
Returns:
The next model available or null if DLV doesn't find another model (in this case the cursor doesn't move).
Throws:
DLV_InvocationException - If any error is occurred during DLV invocation.
NoModelsComputed - If a computeModel function is never executed.

Throws:
NoSuchModelException - Is trown if there isn't current model for this program now.
NoModelsComputed - If a computeModel function is never executed.

setFrontEnd

public void setFrontEnd(java.lang.String frontEnd)
Set the DLV frontend parameters. -FB Brave reasoning -FC Cautious reasoning -FD Abductive diagnosis -FDmin Abductive diagnosis, subset minimal -FDsingle Abductive diagnosis, single error -FR Reiter's diagnosis -FRmin Reiter's diagnosis, subset minimal -FRsingle Reiter's diagnosis, single error -FP Planning with "K" Action Language -FPopt ...find optimistic plans in batch mode -FPsec ...find secure plans in batch mode -FPc Planning with "C" Action Language -FPcheck= Secure Check method . Currently implemented: 1,2 -FPsoundcheck= A sound secure check method. -FPcompletecheck= A complete secure check method. -planlength= Maximum plan length for planning frontend -plancache= Size of the plan cache (number of plans, defaults to 10000) -FS SQL3 If you set a null value this option will be unsetted.
Parameters:
frontend - Is a String written with DLV invocation syntax.

setCostBound

public void setCostBound(java.lang.String costbound)
Set the value of costbound option. Costbound option finds models with cost <= (N=_ indicates that no bound is required). If you set a null value this option will be unsetted.
Parameters:
costbound - is a string like N,...,N.

setDeterministicConsequences

public void setDeterministicConsequences(boolean dc)
If set DLV only computes the deterministic consequences.
Parameters:
dc - if true the -det option is set

setInstantiate

public void setInstantiate(boolean i)
If set DLV only ground and out the instantiation.
Parameters:
i - if true the -instantiate option is set

setNumberOfModels

public void setNumberOfModels(int N)
If set DLV computes at most stable models. If you set a negative integer this option will be unsetted. (set -n option to )
Parameters:
n - Maximum number of stable models.

setMaxint

public void setMaxint(int n)
Limit integers to [0,]. (set -N option to ) If you set a negative integer this option will be unsetted.
Parameters:
N - Is maxint.

setOptimizationOptions

public void setOptimizationOptions(java.lang.String opt)
Set the DLV Optimization Options parameters. -O0 Disable all optimizations. -OR[-] Input rewriting. -OGp[-] Use special grounder for propositional input. -OGo(0|1|2) Grounding performs (no|simple|advanced) dynamic body reordering. -OGs Grounding employs semi-naive evaluation. -OH[-] Heuristics. -OM- Special Model Checker mode. Not for general use! -OMb[-] Model-checking employs novel backtracking technique. -OP- Disable partial model checking. -OPf Partial model checking ``forwards''. -OPb Partial model checking during backtracking. Default options: -OR -OGp -OGo2 -OGs -OH -OMb -OPb If you set a null value this option will be unsetted.
Parameters:
opt - is a String in DLV invocation syntax

setFilter

public void setFilter(java.lang.String[] filter)
Includes only instances of predicate specified in filter parameter in output. (It works like a concatenation of -filter= option) If you set a null value this option will be unsetted.
Parameters:
filter - Is an array of predicate names.

setPFilter

public void setPFilter(java.lang.String[] filter)
Includes only positive instances of predicate specified in filter parameter in output. (Is like a concatenation of -pfilter= option) If you set a null value this option will be unsetted.
Parameters:
filter - Is an array of predicate names.

setIncludeFacts

public void setIncludeFacts(boolean ifact)
If set DLV includes facts as part of the output.
Parameters:
ifact - If true the -facts option is set else -nofact option is set-

setGenerateAllPossibilyModels

public void setGenerateAllPossibilyModels(boolean pm)
If set DLV out all (possibly not optimal) models during computation of weak constraints.
Parameters:
pm - If true the -wctrace option is set.

setDLV_PATH

public void setDLV_PATH(java.lang.String DLV_Path)
Set the full pathname of DLV.
Parameters:
path - Is the full pathname of DLV.

getWarnings

public java.lang.String getWarnings()
After calling DLV function returns the warning messages which DLV out in stderr. This function may block the current thread until the warning messages are read.
Returns:
A String which contains the warning messages which DLV out in stderr, null otherwise.

addModel

public void addModel(Model m)

getStatus

public byte getStatus()
Gets the status of this DLVProcess istance (see static constants).
Returns:
The status of this DLVProcess istance: RUNNING if DLV is running; FINISHED if DLV process terminated execution; KILLED if DLV process was killed.

public static void main(java.lang.String[] Args)
